subject: Technology
title: Life After Social Media: Is It Possible?
description: One-minute skill: Life After Social Media: Is It Possible?.

hook.text: People who quit social media report better sleep, less anxiety, and more free time. They also feel profoundly isolated.

buildup.text: Social media has become infrastructure. Event invitations, community groups, and news all live on these platforms.

discovery.text: Studies show a one-month social media break reduces depression and anxiety significantly, but the effects fade when people return.

twist.text: Quitting isn't realistic for most people. Social media is now woven into professional networking, activism, and family connection.

climax.text: The goal isn't quitting. It's using social media intentionally, like a tool, rather than letting it use you.

punchline.text: You can't quit social media. But you can choose how it fits your life.

quiz.question: What do studies show about taking a break from social media?
options: It reduces depression and anxiety, but effects fade when people return
It permanently cures social media addiction
